Figure 1 shows the waveform with the distance between two consecutive crests or troughs as the wavelength.
The wavelength (λ) of the wave is 4 m.
Figure 2 shows the time taken for one complete oscillation as the period.
The period (T) of the wave is 4 s.
Wave speed (v) is given by the formula v = λ/T.
Substituting λ = 4 m and T = 4 s into the formula gives v = 1 m/s.
The direction of wave propagation is to the right, and the wave speed is 1 m/s.
